disc:
Guttate psoriasis is more common in young adults. It is a variant of psoriasis, characterized by small erythematous papules and plaques. Trunk and extremities are commonly involved in 2-15mm plaques covered by fine scales.

In addition to genetic factors, preceding Streptococcal infections have been identified as a contributing factor.

Diagnosis is mainly clinical and a biopsy can be helpful in doubtful cases.

It may remit spontaneously over a few weeks/months or progress to chronic plaque psoriasis.

Widespread lesions are treated with narrow-band ultraviolet B phototherapy. Alternatives include topical steroids, vitamin D analogs, and other phototherapy methods.
